Jialu Wei, Ph.D.

@ Iowa State University

Quantitative Genetics | Plant Breeding

Statistics | Bioinformatics

jlwei@iastate.edu

Enthusiastic and self-motivated quantitative geneticist with solid background in statistics and plant breeding.
Highly competent in programming, data analysis and visualizations.
Meticulous planner who is a capable and collaborative scientific researcher.
Engages and enjoys interacting with people from different backgrounds.
Problem solver who is prepared to go against the grain and thrives as a team member or when performing solo tasks.

Research Projects

Sorghum

Dissection of Phenotypic Plasticity in Flowering Time and Plant Height in Sorghum under Natural Field Conditions
Maize

Investigating Dynamic Heat Stress Responses with Diverse Maize Inbreds:
Embrace Complexity to Find Simplicity
